data.reddit:
Age: 21

Height: 6’

Weight: 205

Gender: male

Race: Caucasian 

Duration of Complaint: 2 weeks(?)

Location: lungs

Current meds: fluticasone prop 50 MCG spray (two sprays each nostril as needed)

Prednisone 40mg (1 time a day for 5 days

Existing issue: decrease in hearing in right ear (maybe related)

Blood pressure: 134/74

The other day I woke up and had hearing loss in my right ear. I figured it might’ve just been water or something so I went about my day and didn’t think much about it. The next day I woke up I noticed it again. Maybe even more so than the morning prior. Over the last three days I’ve experienced hearing loss in my right year. ETN doc prescribed the meds listed above saying she thinks it’s a viral thing. I had no fluid in my ear and no blockage, thus no reason for hearing loss. We discovered I have auditory processing disorder and that my left ear is very good (-5,~10) and my right ear is on the low end of normal (15-25) but is notably shittier than my left. To the point where I’m misjudging sounds I would normally be fine with. Bad in particular was at 25 (minimum score for “normal hearing.” Any higher any it’s considered hearing loss. 

This is where it gets a little more interesting. I have had shortness of breath. Constantly yawning and feeling like I can’t catch my breath. I thought this was an anxiety related thing because it started two weeks ago while I was on vacation with my now fiancé. I proposed well on that vacation so I figured it was my body‘s response to being nervous and full of anxiety. I didn’t think much of it but she pointed out yesterday that I was still yawning and not able to catch my breath. I don’t feel like I’m struggling to get oxygen or like I’m smothering but I know you Yawn When your body needs to breathe and get more oxygen which is mildly concerning. I decided to Google it out of curiosity and of course the Internet says I’m dying so I thought I’d come here and ask for anybody on here to give their thoughts.

Thinking about it now on my way to work today on my way to work I got super tired out of no where. Maybe I didn’t get a good nights sleep and just got tired during my hour and a half drive but I was struggling to keep my eyes open. Once again it could be nothing? I know when you look hard enough for anything you can will it into existence lol

Thank you for reading and for any advice you may leave. Feel free to ask questions.
